title: Have you ever met a K-pop idol who was rude to you? For what reason? - Quora

response.answer_text: i met nct 127 earlier this year in new york. most people in my situation would be too excited too focus on how their personalities are, but i guess in the 15 seconds i saw them and i was being pushed around by bodyguards and fans, i could see how they really were. they were TIRED. you can see it on their face, in the way they sit. i could never tell in videos or pictures of them, but i could tell up close. at first i told people i was disappointed because they seemed 'aloof', doyoung sat in silence while people stood next to him, taeil just softly smiled when i said i loved him. (i was on the side with doyoung, taeil, and yuta) but soon enough i realized they were just overworked, probably stressed and just tired. and this was just the beginning of their us tour, it was the first stop in new jersey. (i went to that concert the day after, it was amazing and i couldn't tell they were tired like i said) another thing is, you expect so much from your idol before you meet them - you think they're gonna fall in love with you on first sight, you think they're gonna be your best friend. but in reality? they don't know you. you don't know them! even though you know EVERYTHING about them.. you're just a stranger. it's the sad truth even to me. i wanna be mark's bff bro. i think i realized that saying i love you to taeil.. i'm just a stranger telling another stranger that i love them. there are idols that say it back, i know that, but i guess it was kind of refreshing to not hear it and to be whacked into my own reality. anyway, they weren't rude to me, they were just real.

Sort of. I was at a fan sign last year. Two of the guys in the group took a look at me and had sort of a … for lack of a better word, disgusted expression. When I reached the table neither would even look at me, much less talk to me. They both signed my album and just slid it down to the next members. The remaining members were super sweet and friendly. I also got really lucky because my bias shook my hand and then after we got a group picture he gave me high fives with both hands. I would have been so sad if he wouldn't even look at me. Honestly, aside from the fact that I'm ugly and obese, I don't know why else they would react that way. I was showered, dressed nice, a little make up, and my hair was done in two french braids. If not for my bias being extra to me, I would have been really bummed out but it all ended up as a bitter sweet memory. ***edit: So I'm going to another fan sign for this group soon. I feel a little nervous but I'm excited because I know my bias is really nice and that's what matters most. I'm also kind of feeling like maybe I'll see if last time was just a fluke or something because I still look relatively the same. I'll post an update. ***edit: 02/24/2020 - I was running so late and didn't get to do the meet and greet. I got there after the concert started. After the concert I got a 1:1 pick with my bias who was sweet as last time.

Sometime in 1997–1998, I went to a rehearsal of one of the music shows during that time. I don’t remember who I saw and got autographs anymore since it was so long ago but what I do remember is Turbo. They were sitting behind us watching some of the performances of the other group. I went up to Mikey and asked for his autograph and he was super nice about it. But when I asked Kim Jong Gook for his, he straight up ignored me. He didn’t even acknowledge my presence and looked straight ahead. I was also sitting right next to him when I was asking him. After that I just didn’t care for him anymore because I thought he was a rotten person. Now, when I look back, yeah he may have been tired, overworked, etc but I still don’t think it was right that he just ignored his fans like that. If he didn’t want fans around him, he could of sat up front or he could of had his managers do some control. I still don’t like him very much and sort of makes me want to throw up on his “My Little Boy” show that portrays him as a good person.

I think people reading this expect good answers. But in reality, they are not rude, they are tired. Most of the time they go abroad to another country and they speak the language that we dont speak in the area they travel to. So I met ab6ix in Singapore for the hi-touch. You will realise that they seem abit rude and have a bit of a bitch face. But I knew they were just tired. Esp Woojin. Since he was also injured. But it's not true that the whole group will act like that. When Youngmin and Woong came up first, they were very very nice. Although it's a Hi-touch. You will be able to tell. But I still love ab6ix lmao.
